requirement.title: Launch detection
requirement.description: The system shall be able to detect launches if the acceleration is larger than \SI{6}{\meter \per \second^2}.

requirement.title: Velocity estimation
requirement.description: The system shall be able to estimate the current velocity. TODO precision.

requirement.title: Velocity control
requirement.description: The system shall be able to control the velocity TODO performance.

requirement.title: Attitude estimation
requirement.description: The system shall be able to estimate the current attitude.

requirement.title: Attitude control
requirement.description: The system shall be able to control the attitude depending on the current flight situation.

requirement.title: Position estimation
requirement.description: The system shall be able to estimate the current position.

requirement.title: Position control
requirement.description: The system shall be able to fly to given positions.

requirement.title: Altitude estimation
requirement.description: The system shall be able to estimate the current altitude over ground.

requirement.title: Altitude control
requirement.description: The system shall be able to control the current altitude over ground.

requirement.title: Mission Execution
requirement.description: A mission, consisting of a list of waypoints with altitude and optional heading and a target point with the same information shall be able to be flown by the plane.

requirement.title: Energy Storage
requirement.description: The airplane has sufficient energy to complete the required distance of 100km.

requirement.title: Debug Channel
requirement.description: The airplane can transmit data while loitering at the launch site.

requirement.title: Debug Display
requirement.description: Debug information transmitted by the plane can be displayed to the user.

requirement.title: Partitioning
requirement.description: The system is partitioned into the following components: \begin{itemize} \item Mechanical: \begin{itemize} \item Airframe (AF) \item Control Surfaces Actuators (CS) \item Electric Powertrain (PW) \end{itemize} \item Electronical: \begin{itemize} \item Flightcontroller (FC) \item Flightcomputer (FCP) \item Power Distribution Board (PDB) \item Navigation Board (NAV) \item RC-Receiver (RX) \item RC-Transmitter (TX) \end{itemize} \item Software: \begin{itemize} \item Flightcontroller-Software (FCS) \item Flightcomputer-Software (FCPS) \item Power Distribution Board Software (PDBS) \item Navigation Board Software (NAVS) \end{itemize} \end{itemize} An overview of the data flow between the partitions is given in Figure\ref{fig:sys-hl:partition}. \begin{figure}[H] \centering \includegraphics[width=.7\textwidth]{chapters/02_requirements/system.eps} \caption{System Partitioning and Data Flow } \label{fig:sys-hl:partition } \end{figure}
requirement.reason: This partitioning allows to implement the components individually from each other and thus allows to limit the complexity of the mission-critical components.

requirement.title: Frequency of FCPS control loop
requirement.description: The FCPS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{10}{\hertz}$.
requirement.reason: This guarantees sufficient time for all calculations but also guarantees a sufficient controller performance as $\SI{100}{\milli\second}$ is much smaller than all time-constants of the orientation-controlled system.

requirement.title: Frequency of FCS control loop
requirement.description: The FCS runs all control loops with at least $\SI{50}{\hertz}$.
requirement.reason: The motor and servo commands can only be sent at this frequency, thus a faster control loop would not bring any advantages.

requirement.title: Manual overrid
requirement.description: The system shall be able to be controlled manually while closer than 200m to the pilot.
requirement.reason: This allows handling errors during launch without risk of crashing.
